externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

post.description: Launches an [asynchronous](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/asynchronous-processes) request to simultaneously run [Launch a GREP request](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-grep), [Request content with cURL](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-curl), and [Test network connectivity with MTR](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-mtr) operations for a URL. It may help you diagnose issues with slow download and high response time. Successful operations return fetched GREP, cURL, and MTR data.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

schema.description: Collects data to use in the Connectivity problems scenario request.

clientIp.description: Client IP for the Connectivity problems scenario to start MTR from. You can use the `ip` value from the `edgeIps` array in the [collected diagnostic data](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records).

edgeLocationId.description: Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to end users experiencing issues with the URL. Run the [List available edge server locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-edge-locations) operation to get this value.

ipVersion.description: IP version for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run cURL and MTR commands, either `IPV4` or `IPV6`.

packetType.description: Packet type for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`.

port.description: Port number for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`.

requestHeaders.description: Customized headers for the `curl` request in the format `header: value`. The request includes [Akamai Pragma headers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/pragma-headers) by default.

runFromSiteShield.description: Runs Connectivity problems from a Site Shield map. To learn more, check [Site Shield requests](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/site-shield-requests).

sensitiveRequestHeaderKeys.description: Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request. Check [Sensitive headers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/sensitive-headers) to see the list of request headers treated as sensitive by default.

spoofEdgeIp.description: IP of the edge server you want to serve traffic from. You can use the `ip` value from the `edgeIps` array in the [collected diagnostic data](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records).

url.description: URL you want to run the Connectivity problems scenario for.

suggestedActions: Look for a packet loss or sudden jumps in the hop time.
For a loss or latency within the end user ISP network, ask the end user to contact thier ISP.
For a loss or latency within Akamai network, contact Akamai Technical Support.
If a packet loss occurs at one hop but does not propogate to the end of the trace, it is irrelevant.
Look for a packet loss or sudden jumps in the hop time.
For a loss or latency within the end user ISP network, ask the end user to contact thier ISP.
For a loss or latency within Akamai network, contact Akamai Technical Support.
If a packet loss occurs at one hop but does not propogate to the end of the trace, it is irrelevant.
Compare the response headers served from edge and origin.
Check for content correctness.
Check content length/bytes served.

executionContext.description: Execution context for MTR. Edge Diagnostics executes MTR between an edge server and the origin server (`EDGE_IP_TO_ORIGIN_IP`) or, if a client IP is present in the request, between an edge server and the client machine (`EDGE_IP_TO_CLIENT_IP`).

executionStatus.description: Status of the MTR request's execution. Possible values are `SUCCESS`, `FAILURE`, or `NOT_EXECUTED`. The `info` member and `FAILURE` in `errorResponse` provide details for `NOT_EXECUTED`.

averageLatency.description: Average latency for all hops, in seconds.

hops.description: Lists network hops with their data.

items.description: Collects network hops with their data.

lastPacketLatency.description: Last measured hop value, useful to detect ongoing problems.

number.description: Index for each hop's count within the full set.

packetLoss.description: Percentage of packets lost for the hop, maximum `100`.

sentPackets.description: Number of packets sent for the hop.

post.description: Requests content using the `curl` command to provide the raw HTML for a URL, including request headers. You can run this operation for a specific location, an edge server IP, or a Site Shield map. If you want to get the data for a location, you need to run the [List available edge server locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-edge-locations) operation first to get `edgeLocationId`. And if you want to run this operation for an IP,  you may need to [verify an IP](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-verify-edge-ip) to check if it belongs to an edge server. If you provide neither a location nor an edge server IP, then Edge Diagnostics runs the operation using a random edge server IP.

post.description: Uses the `dig` command to provide DNS details for the location  of an edge server, a hostname or a domain name, or a GTM hostname. The results may help you diagnose issues with domain name resolutions.  You can run this operation either for a specific location or an edge IP. If you want to get the data for a location, you need to run the [List available edge server locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-edge-locations) operation first to get `edgeLocationId`. To run this operation for an IP,  you may need to [verify an IP](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-verify-edge-ip), if it belongs to an edge server. And to run this operation for a GTM hostname, you need to run the [List GTM properties](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-gtm-properties) operation first. If you don't provide neither a location ID nor an edge server IP, then Edge Diagnostics runs the operation using a random edge server IP.

edgeLocationId.description: Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to your end users. Provide either this value or `edgeIp`. To get this value, run the [List available edge server locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-edge-locations) operation first.

hostname.description: Hostname or a domain name you want to get the data for. For a GTM hostname, run the [List GTM properties](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-gtm-properties) operation first, to get this value.

queryType.description: DNS record type you want to get. Possible values are: `A`, `AAAA`, `SOA`, `CNAME`, `PTR`, `MX`, `NS`, `TXT`, `SRV`, `CAA`, and `ANY`. To learn more about them, check [Supported DNS record types](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/domain-details-dig#supported-dns-record-types).

To get a subset of edge servers supporting metadata tracer, run the [List available edge server locations for metadata tracing](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-mdt-locations) operation.

post.description: Launches an [asynchronous](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/asynchronous-processes) request to fetch summary and logs for an error with a specific reference code. You can also translate any Global Request Number (GRN) generated by the Property Manager's Global Request Number behavior. You can get the error logs from the last 6 or 24 hours depending on the server and traffic conditions. For operations in progress, the returned object contains `retryAfter`, `requestId`, and `link`. In this case, wait for the duration of the `retryAfter` interval, then either use the `requestId` to run the [Get a translate error string response](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-error-translator-request) operation, or simply GET the `link`.

post.description: Returns HTTP status codes distribution statistics from delivering a URL or CP code based on the nine-second traffic sample from the last two minutes. You can filter the results by `delivery` and `errorType`. The `delivery` is the delivery type of your resource, either `ENHANCED_TLS` or `STANDARD_TLS`. The `STANDARD_TLS` value returns data for the HTTP traffic with Standard TLS hostname,  whereas `ENHANCED_TLS` for the HTTPS traffic with Enhanced TLS hostname.  Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics checks on its own the type of delivery used by your resource and returns data for it. If your resource uses both delivery types, then Edge Diagnostics returns data for the type which got all data collected faster. If you choose the delivery type not used by your resource, then the results are empty. If you want to add this filter, you can run the [Get an edge hostname](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-hostnames/reference/get-edgehostnameid)  operation in [Edge Hostnames API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-hostnames/reference/api) to confirm the delivery type of your resource. It's the `securityType` value.  The `errorType` filter is for the traffic's direction. The `EDGE_ERRORS` value returns data for the traffic between a customer and an edge server and `ORIGIN_ERRORS` between the edge server and the origin. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics returns data for both directions.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

schema.description: Collects a URL or CP code for which you want to get the traffic's HTTP status codes distribution statistics and filters.

cpCode.description: CP code you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or `url`.

delivery.description: Type of network you want to get traffic data for, either `STANDARD_TLS` or `ENHANCED_TLS`. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics checks on its own the type of delivery used by the requested CP code or URL and returns data for it. If it uses both types, then Edge Diagnostics returns data for the type which got all data collected faster. If you choose the delivery type not used by your resource, then the results are empty. To verify the delivery type of your resource, run the [Get an edge hostname](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-hostnames/reference/get-edgehostnameid#getedgehostname) operation in [Edge Hostnames API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-hostnames/reference/api). It is the `securityType` value.

errorType.description: Type of traffic direction you want to get the data for, either `EDGE_ERRORS` or `ORIGIN_ERRORS`. The `EDGE_ERRORS` value returns data for the edge server response to a client and `ORIGIN_ERRORS` for the edge server forward request to an origin server. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics returns data for both.

url.description: Fully qualified URL you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or `cpCode`.

schema.description: Collects HTTP status codes distribution statistics for the requested traffic. The content of the response differs depending on your filters from the request. If you chose `delivery` not used by your resource, then the results are empty.

completedTime.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the request was completed.

createdTime.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the request was submitted.

executionStatus.description: Status of the request's execution, either `SUCCESS` or `FAILURE`.

cpCode.description: CP code you want to get the error statistics for. You need to provide either this value or `url`.

delivery.description: Type of network you want to get traffic data for, either `STANDARD_TLS` or `ENHANCED_TLS`. The `STANDARD_TLS` value provides HTTP traffic data for Standard TLS hostnames and `ENHANCED_TLS` provides HTTPS traffic data for Enhanced TLS hostnames. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics checks on its own the type of delivery used by your resource and returns data for it. If your resource uses both delivery types, then Edge Diagnostics returns data for the type which got all data collected faster. If you choose the delivery type not used by your resource, then the results are empty. To verify the delivery type of you resource, run the [Get an edge hostname](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-hostnames/reference/get-edgehostnameid) operation in [Edge Hostnames API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-hostnames/reference/api). It's the `securityType` value.

errorType.description: Type of traffic direction you want to get the data for, either `EDGE_ERRORS` or `ORIGIN_ERRORS`. The `EDGE_ERRORS` value returns data for the edge server response to a client and `ORIGIN_ERRORS` for the edge server forward request to an origin server. Without this filter, Edge Diagnostics returns data for both.

post.description: Launches an [asynchronous](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/asynchronous-processes) request to fetch logs for an edge server IP address using the `grep` command.  To verify if an IP belongs to an edge server, run the [Verify an IP](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-verify-edge-ip) operation first. If you known the exact values to filter the logs by and you want to get the data directly, run the synchronous [Get specific logs](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-grep) operation.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

schema.description: Collects data to use in the asynchronous `grep` request.

arls.description: Collects ARLs to filter the logs by.

comparison.description: Comparison filter type. Possible values are either `CONTAINS` if you want to get the logs for specific `value` or `NOT_CONTAINS` if you want to exclude specific `value` from logs.

value.description: Lists ARLs to filter the logs by in relation to the `comparison` value.

clientIps.description: Lists client IPs to filter the logs by.

cpCodes.description: Lists CP codes you want to get the logs for. You need to provide either this value or `hostnames`.

edgeIp.description: Edge IP you want to get the logs for. If you don't know if an IP is the edge IP, run the [Verify an IP](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-verify-edge-ip) operation first. You can use the edge server IP value from the `answerSection` array in the [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig) operation response or the `ip` value from the `edgeIps` array in the [collected diagnostic data](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records).

end.description: ISO 8601 timestamp for a point of time in the past when the log search window ends.

hostnames.description: Lists hostnames you want to get the logs for. You need to provide either this value or `cpCodes`.

httpStatusCodes.description: Filters the logs by specific HTTP status codes.

comparison.description: Comparison filter type. Possible values are either `EQUALS` if you want to get the logs for specific `value` or `NOT_EQUALS` if you want to exclude specific `value` from logs.

value.description: Lists HTTP status codes to filter the logs by in relation to the `comparison` value.

logType.description: Log record type you want to get. Possible values are: `R` for client requests to an edge server, `F` for forward requests from an edge server to the origin, or `BOTH`.

start.description: ISO 8601 timestamp for a point of time in the past when the log search window starts. You can get the logs from either the last 6 or 24 hours depending on the server and traffic conditions. The recommended 10-minute periods ensure that data fetches quickly and you get the most relevant logs.

userAgents.description: Lists user agents to filter the logs by.

suggestedActions: Check for long times.
Check content length/bytes served.

To get the IP, you may need to run the [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig) or [Get diagnostic data of a group](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records) operation first. This is the IP value from the `answerSection` array in the [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig) operation response or the `ip` value from the `edgeIps` array in the [collected diagnostic data](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records).

post.description: Launches an [asynchronous](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/asynchronous-processes) request to trace metadata for a URL configured in Property Manager. The metadata tracing works for the current property version active either on staging or production. To run the operation for a location, run the [List available locations for metadata tracing](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-mdt-locations) operation first to get available values. If you don't provide a location ID or an edge server IP, then Edge Diagnostics runs the operation using a random location.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

schema.description: Collects data to use in the metadata tracer request.

edgeIp.description: IP of the edge server you want to run the operation from. If you don't know if an IP is the edge IP, run the [Verify an IP](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-verify-edge-ip) operation. Provide either this value or `mdtLocationId`.

httpMethod.description: HTTP method you want to use to run the operation, either `HEAD`, `POST`, or the default `GET` method.

mdtLocationId.description: Unique identifier for an available location closest to your end users. To get this value, run the [List available locations for metadata tracing](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-mdt-locations) operation first. For `GET` and `HEAD`, provide either this value or `edgeIp`.

requestHeaders.description: Customized headers for metadata tracer request in the format `header: value`. Check [Pragma headers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/pragma-headers) for the list of Akamized Pragma headers you can use here.

sensitiveRequestHeaderKeys.description: Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request. Check [Sensitive headers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/sensitive-headers) to see the list of request headers treated as sensitive by default.

url.description: URL configured in Property Manager you want to get the metadata trace for.

useStaging.description: Runs the request on the staging environment, `false` by default.

groupId.description: Identifier for the group. The value may be `null` for properties provisioned by only one contract.

propertyId.description: Identifier for the property the metadata tracer was run for.

propertyName.description: Name of the property the metadata tracer was run for.

propertyVersion.description: Version of the property that a rule tree represents.

ruleFormat.description: Versioned set of features and criteria that are currently applied to a rule tree. To learn more, check [API versioning](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/api-versioning).

rules.description: Specifies the executable logic to apply to cached edge content. The outer envelope's `rules` object specifies the relevant top-level `default` rule object. To learn more, check [Rule trees](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/rule-trees).

options.description: Flags that apply to the top-level rule object.

is_secure.description: When enabled, serves the property's content over SSL. Doing so may enable additional rule behaviors.

behaviors.description: Series of [behavior](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-behaviors) objects, which execute after the set of `criteria` evaluates. Behavior and criteria objects are structured identically. Optional on nested rules.

options.description: A variable set of options that configure each behavior. See the [behavior](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/ga-behaviors) and [criteria](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/ga-criteria) reference for details on each.

locked.description: Indicates a behavior or criteria that you arrange with your Akamai representative to lock. Typically, you prevent further modifications to protect sensitive data from erroneous changes.

uuid.description: A data hash that indicates an _advanced_ behavior. When present, you may not modify the contents of the behavior, and need to provide the same `uuid` value when modifying the rule tree. See [Advanced and locked features](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/advanced-and-locked-features).

executionStatus.description: Status of the behavior's execution. Possible values are `SUCCESS`, `PARTIAL_SUCCESS`, `INDETERMINATE`, `FAILURE`, or `NOT_EXECUTED`. The `INDETERMINATE` status means that the summary for this behavior wasn't generated and you need to refer to the XML to verify it.

end.description: End line number of a behavior in `arlDataXml`.

start.description: Start line number of a behavior in `arlDataXml`.

children.description: Series of nested rules that execute after the current rule's `criteria` and `behaviors`.

comments.description: Comment that helps track the rule's function in Property Manager.

criteria.description: Series of [criteria](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/latest-criteria) objects, which form a set of logical tests that may prevent the rule's `behaviors` from executing. Behavior and criteria objects are structured identically.

criteriaMustSatisfy.description: Collects the response headers in the format `header: value`.

uuid.description: Data hash that indicates the rule contains at least one _advanced_ behavior or criteria.

variables.description: Specifies a variable. To learn more, see [Variables](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference/variables).

description.description: Text for you to keep track of how you use each variable.

hidden.description: When enabled, the variable is suppressed from session response headers. Useful when testing content as described in the [Debug variables](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/debug-variables) section.

name.description: The underlying root name of the variable, which needs to be unique within the set of `variables`.

sensitive.description: When enabled, the variable is suppressed from session responses as `hidden` ones, but it also can't be invoked within any behaviors that assign values to cookies or response headers. You also can't assign a `sensitive` variable to another one that isn't `sensitive`, and you can't add it to custom logging fields. Use this more stringent option for any personally identifiable information, typically after initially testing on the staging network.

value.description: Initializes a default value. Omitting this member initializes the variable with an empty string.

executionStatus.description: Status of the request's execution. Possible values are `SUCCESS`, `FAILURE`, or `IN_PROGRESS`.

internalIp.description: If your request contained `edgeLocationId` then this is the IP of a machine in that location. If you run the operation for a virtual IP, then this is the IP of a machine behind that virtual IP.

link.description: Link to get fetched metadata tracer response after the `retryAfter` interval passes. It occurs only for operations with the `IN_PROGRESS` status.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for a request. To get this value, run the corresponding POST operation.
parameters.name: requestId

post.description: Uses MTR to provide information about packet loss and latency between an edge server IP, location, or Site Shield map and a remote destination. To run this operation for an IP, you may need to [verify an IP](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-verify-edge-ip) if it belongs to an edge server. To run this operation for a GTM hostname, run [List GTM properties](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-gtm-properties) and [List test and target IPs for a GTM hostname](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-gtm-property-domain-gtm-property-ips) operations first to get the test and target IPs for the hostname.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

schema.description: Collects data to use in MTR. Objects created for an IP address or a hostname differ from these created for a GTM hostname in terms of included data.

destination.description: MTR destination compliant with the `destinationType`, either a hostname or a destination IP. To build an object for a GTM hostname, enter the `target` value returned by the [List test and target IPs for a GTM hostname](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-gtm-property-domain-gtm-property-ips) operation. For a Site Shield hostname, enter a destination IP address.

destinationType.description: Type of destination input, either `IP` or `HOST`. To build an object for a GTM or Site Shield hostname, choose `IP`.

packetType.description: Packet type used by MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`.

port.description: Port to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`. Provide it only for `destinationType` set to `HOST`.

siteShieldHostname.description: Site Shield hostname you want to run the MTR for.

source.description: MTR source compliant with the `sourceType`, either an edge server IP or a location. For locations, enter `edgeLocationId` for an edge server location closest to your end users. To get this value, run the [List available edge server locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-edge-locations) operation first. For edge IPs, use the edge server IP value from the `answerSection` array in the [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig) operation response. To build an object for a GTM hostname, enter the `testIp` value returned by the [List test and target IPs for a GTM hostname](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-gtm-property-domain-gtm-property-ips) operation.

sourceType.description: Type of the source input, either `EDGE_IP` or `LOCATION`. To build an object for a GTM hostname, choose `EDGE_IP`.

200.description: The response provides the MTR results.

post.description: Launches an [asynchronous](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/asynchronous-processes) request to simultaneously run [Launch a GREP request](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-grep), [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig), [Request content with cURL](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-curl), [Test network connectivity with MTR](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-mtr) and [Translate an Akamaized URL](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-translated-url) operations for a URL. Successful operations return fetched GREP, dig, cURL, and MTR data and [Akamaized URL (ARL)](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/arl-syntax) details.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

schema.description: Collects data to use in the URL health check request.

edgeLocationId.description: Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to your end users. Run the [List available edge server locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-edge-locations) operation to get this value.

ipVersion.description: IP version for the URL health check to use to run cURL and MTR, either `IPV4` or `IPV6`.

packetType.description: Packet type for the URL health check to use to run MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`. Provide it only for requests with `CONNECTIVITY` in the `viewsAllowed` array.

port.description: Port number for the URL health check to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`. Provide it only for requests with `CONNECTIVITY` in the `viewsAllowed` array.

queryType.description: DNS query type you want to get the records of with the DIG command. Possible values are: `A`, `AAAA`, `SOA`, `CNAME`, `PTR`, `MX`, `NS`, `TXT`, `SRV`, `CAA`, and `ANY`. To learn more about them, check [Supported DNS record types](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/domain-details-dig#supported-dns-record-types).

requestHeaders.description: Customized headers for the `curl` request in the format `header: value`. The request includes [Akamai Pragma headers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/pragma-headers) by default.

runFromSiteShield.description: Runs a URL health check from a Site Shield map. To learn more, check [Site Shield requests](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/site-shield-requests).

sensitiveRequestHeaderKeys.description: Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request. Check [Sensitive headers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/sensitive-headers) to see the list of request headers treated as sensitive by default.

spoofEdgeIp.description: IP of the edge server you want to serve traffic from. You can use the edge server IP value from the `answerSection` array in the [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig) operation response.

url.description: URL you want to run the health check for.

viewsAllowed.description: Additional operations for the URL health check to run. `CONNECTIVITY` runs the [Test network connectivity with MTR](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-mtr) operation and `LOGS` runs the [Get specific logs](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-grep) operation.

suggestedActions: Look for a packet loss or sudden jumps in the hop time.
For a loss or latency within the end user ISP network, ask the end user to contact thier ISP.
For a loss or latency within Akamai network, contact Akamai Technical Support.
If a packet loss occurs at one hop but does not propogate to the end of the trace, it is irrelevant.
Compare the response headers served from edge and origin.
Check for content correctness.
Check content length/bytes served.

requestHeaders: Pragma: akamai-x-cache-on, akamai-x-cache-remote-on, akamai-x-check-cacheable, akamai-x-get-true-cache-key, akamai-x-get-cache-key, akamai-x-serial-no, akamai-x-get-request-id

suggestedActions: Check for long times.
Check content length/bytes served.

fObjectStatus.o: The origin server was contacted for the request.
fObjectStatus.x: Either 'no-store' is turned on by metadata and not disabled by "!no-store" in the response or the downstream TTL was set by metadata and not by the response header.

If a packet loss occurs at one hop but does not propogate to the end of the trace, it is irrelevant.
If source Ip country and destination IP country is same then there should not be any hops outside the country.

spoofEdgeIp.description: IP of the edge server you want to serve traffic from. You can use the edge server IP value from the `answerSection` array in the [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig) operation response.

url.description: URL you want to run the health check for.

viewsAllowed.description: Additional operations for the URL health check to run. `CONNECTIVITY` runs the [Test network connectivity with MTR](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-mtr) operation and `LOGS` runs the [Get specific logs](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-grep) operation.

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the URL health check request. Store this value to run [Get a URL health check response](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-url-health-check-requests) operation.

retryAfter.description: Number of seconds when the request is estimated to have processed. It occurs only for operations with the `IN_PROGRESS` status.

get.description: Returns the status of the [asynchronous](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/asynchronous-processes) [Run the URL health check](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-url-health-check) request. Operations with the `SUCCESS` status include also fetched GREP, dig, cURL, and MTR data.
get.summary: Get a URL health check response

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

200.description: The response provides the status of the request and its details.

suggestedActions: Look for a packet loss or sudden jumps in the hop time.
For a loss or latency within the end user ISP network, ask the end user to contact thier ISP.
For a loss or latency within Akamai network, contact Akamai Technical Support.
If a packet loss occurs at one hop but does not propogate to the end of the trace, it is irrelevant.
Compare the response headers served from edge and origin.
Check for content correctness.
Check content length/bytes served.

requestHeaders: Pragma: akamai-x-cache-on, akamai-x-cache-remote-on, akamai-x-check-cacheable, akamai-x-get-true-cache-key, akamai-x-get-cache-key, akamai-x-serial-no, akamai-x-get-request-id

suggestedActions: Check for long times.
Check content length/bytes served.

fObjectStatus.o: The origin server was contacted for the request.
fObjectStatus.x: Either 'no-store' is turned on by metadata and not disabled by "!no-store" in the response or the downstream TTL was set by metadata and not by the response header.

suggestedActions: Look for a packet loss or sudden jumps in the hop time.
For a loss or latency within the end user ISP network, ask the end user to contact thier ISP.
For a loss or latency within Akamai network, contact Akamai Technical Support.
If a packet loss occurs at one hop but does not propogate to the end of the trace, it is irrelevant.
If source Ip country and destination IP country is same then there should not be any hops outside the country.
Compare the response headers served from edge and origin.
Check for content correctness.
Check content length/bytes served.

; <<>> DiG 9.11.3-1ubuntu1.14aka10.0.8-Ubuntu <<>> www.atcuser15.akamaiu.com -t A
;; global options: +cmd
;; Got answer:
;; ->>HEADER<<- opcode: QUERY, status: NOERROR, id: 27583
;; flags: qr rd ra; QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 4, AUTHORITY: 0, ADDITIONAL: 1

;; OPT PSEUDOSECTION:
; EDNS: version: 0, flags:; udp: 4096
; COOKIE: 5ed2048bbeaf4087d1154fba6153f49926837baa0b15243d (good)
;; QUESTION SECTION:
;www.atcuser15.akamaiu.com.	IN	A

;; ANSWER SECTION:
www.atcuser15.akamaiu.com. 82108 IN	CNAME	www.example.com.edgesuite.net.
www.example.com.edgesuite.net. 17308 IN CNAME	a1580.dscr.akamai.net.
a1580.dscr.akamai.net.	20	IN	A	23.50.51.203
a1580.dscr.akamai.net.	20	IN	A	23.50.51.240

;; Query time: 1 msec
;; SERVER: 127.0.0.1#53(127.0.0.1)
;; WHEN: Wed Sep 29 05:07:37 UTC 2021
;; MSG SIZE  rcvd: 202

suggestedActions: Check for long times.
Check content length/bytes served.

request.description: Specifies your URL health check request.

edgeLocationId.description: Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to your end users. Run the [List available edge server locations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-edge-locations) operation to get this value.

ipVersion.description: IP version for the URL health check to use to run cURL and MTR, either `IPV4` or `IPV6`.

packetType.description: Packet type for the URL health check to use to run MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`. Provide it only for requests with `CONNECTIVITY` in the `viewsAllowed` array.

port.description: Port number for the URL health check to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`. Provide it only for requests with `CONNECTIVITY` in the `viewsAllowed` array.

queryType.description: DNS query type you want to get the records of with the DIG command. Possible values are: `A`, `AAAA`, `SOA`, `CNAME`, `PTR`, `MX`, `NS`, `TXT`, `SRV`, `CAA`, and `ANY`. To learn more about them, check [Supported DNS record types](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/domain-details-dig#supported-dns-record-types).

requestHeaders.description: Customized headers for the `curl` request in the format `header: value`. The request includes [Akamai Pragma headers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/pragma-headers) by default.

runFromSiteShield.description: Runs a URL health check from a Site Shield map. To learn more, check [Site Shield requests](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/site-shield-requests).

sensitiveRequestHeaderKeys.description: Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request. Check [Sensitive headers](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/sensitive-headers) to see the list of request headers treated as sensitive by default.

spoofEdgeIp.description: IP of the edge server you want to serve traffic from. You can use the edge server IP value from the `answerSection` array in the [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig) operation response.

url.description: URL you want to run the health check for.

viewsAllowed.description: Additional operations for the URL health check to run. `CONNECTIVITY` runs the [Test network connectivity with MTR](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-mtr) operation and `LOGS` runs the [Get specific logs](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-grep) operation.

post.description: Generates a diagnostic link for you to share with end users of a particular URL or IP acceleration hostname experiencing similar issues.  After an end user clicks the link, the tool gathers necessary diagnostic data and asks the end user to submit it. Once submitted, you can check the collected data with  the [Get diagnostic data of a group](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records) operation. Each link is valid for 7 days of 50 submissions. To get the list of IP acceleration hostname you can collect diagnostic data for, run the [List IP acceleration hostnames](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-ipa-hostnames) operation first.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

get.description: Lists groups created for collecting diagnostic data and their details. A group stores diagnostic data of end users of a particular domain experiencing similar issues submitted with the specific diagnostic link. To create the diagnostic link, run the [Generate a diagnostic link](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-user-diagnostic-data-groups) operation. To check the data collected for a group, store the returned `groupId` value and use it to run the [Get diagnostic data of a group](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records) operation.

digResults.description: Lists the DIG response and details about the request. It shows only for the `includeDig` query parameter of the request set to `true` and fetched `edgeIps` details.

createdBy.description: Username who submitted the DIG request.

createdTime.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the DIG request was submitted.

executionStatus.description: Dig request status. Possible values are `SUCCESS`, `IN_PROGRESS`, or `FAILURE`.

edgeIds.description: Unique identifiers for edge IPs for the DIG request.

hostname.description: Hostname or a domain name you want to get the data for.

queryType.description: DNS record type you want to get. Possible values are: `A`, `AAAA`, `SOA`, `CNAME`, `PTR`, `MX`, `NS`, `TXT`, `SRV`, `CAA`, and `ANY`. To learn more about them, check [Supported DNS record types](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/domain-details-dig#supported-dns-record-types).

answerSection.description: Collects a DNS record of answering servers.

items.description: Specifies a DNS record that appears within a response of the [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig) operation, in `answerSection` or `authoritySection`.

hostname.description: Hostname you requested the data for.

preferenceValue.description: Preference value, only valid for records of the `MX` type, otherwise `null`.

recordClass.description: Class of the record, typically `IN` for *internet*.

recordType.description: Requested record type. Possible values are: `A`, `AAAA`, `SOA`, `CNAME`, `PTR`, `MX`, `NS`, `TXT`, `SRV`, `CAA`, and `ANY`. To learn more about them, check [Supported DNS record types](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/domain-details-dig#supported-dns-record-types).

ttl.description: Server's default number of seconds to keep content cached.

value.description: Record's value, either another domain or a final IP address.

authoritySection.description: Collects a DNS record of servers authorized to answer.

items.description: Specifies a DNS record that appears within a response of the [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig) operation, in `answerSection` or `authoritySection`.

hostname.description: Hostname you requested the data for.

preferenceValue.description: Preference value, only valid for records of the `MX` type, otherwise `null`.

To learn more about them, check [Supported DNS record types](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/domain-details-dig#supported-dns-record-types).

ttl.description: Server's default number of seconds to keep content cached.

value.description: Record's value, either another domain or a final IP address.

edgeIps.description: Lists data about edge servers hosting `url` or `ipaHostname`. If it doesn't occur, it's either because of a system error or the client DNS has an EDNS Client Subnet (ECS).

associatedDnsId.description: DNS IP assigned to the edge server.

id.description: Unique identifier for the edge server.

ipLocation.description: Collects data about the location of edge servers hosting the URL.

asNumber.description: Autonomous System Number the edge IP maps to.

city.description: Closest city within a 50-mile radius the edge IP maps to.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 country code the edge IP maps to.

regionCode.description: ISO 3166 region code the edge IP maps to.

regionId.description: Unique identifier for the edge server region.

mtrResults.description: Lists MTR results and details about the request. It shows only for the `includeMtr` query parameter of the request set to `true` and fetched `edgeIps` details.

createdBy.description: Username who submitted the MTR request.

createdTime.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the MTR request was submitted.

executionStatus.description: MTR request status. Possible values are `SUCCESS`, `IN_PROGRESS`, or `FAILURE`.

destinationId.description: Unique identifier for the IP address being the destination of the MTR.

ipVersion.description: IP version used by MTR. Possible values are either `IPV4` or `IPV6`.

packetType.description: Packet type used by MTR. Possible values are either `TCP` or `ICMP`.

port.description: Port number used by MTR, either `80` or `443`.

sourceIds.description: Unique identifier for the IP address being the source of the MTR.

averageLatency.description: Average latency for all hops, in seconds.

hops.description: Lists network hops with their data.

items.description: Collects network hops with their data.

averageLatency.description: Average hop value, useful to detect ongoing problems.

host.description: Host or domain name for the hop.

asNumber.description: Autonomous System Number the edge IP maps to.

city.description: Closest city within a 50-mile radius the edge IP maps to.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 country code the edge IP maps to.

regionCode.description: ISO 3166 region code the edge IP maps to.

lastPacketLatency.description: Last measured hop value, useful to detect ongoing problems.

number.description: Index for each hop's count within the full set.

packetLoss.description: Percentage of packets lost for the hop, maximum `100`.

sentPackets.description: Number of packets sent for the hop.

host.description: Hostname within the edge network that corresponds to the `source` IP address.

packetLoss.description: Percentage of packets lost, maximum `100`.

startTime.description: Epoch timestamp marking when MTR was run.

preferredClientIp.description: Specifies IP address preferred by the end user to connect to the server.

associatedDnsId.description: DNS IP assigned to the server.

id.description: Unique identifier for the server of the preferred IP.

ip.description: IP address preferred by the end user.

asNumber.description: Autonomous System Number the edge IP maps to.

city.description: Closest city within a 50-mile radius the edge IP maps to.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 country code the edge IP maps to.

regionCode.description: ISO 3166 region code the edge IP maps to.

protocol.description: HTTP protocol used to connect the client and `www.t1info.net`.

uniqueId.description: Unique identifier for the collected data. You can share it with the technical support to identify the submitted data.

userAgent.description: Application, operating system, vendor, and optionally the version of the requesting user agent.

submissionsRemaining.description: Number of submissions remaining with `diagnosticLink`. Each link can collect up to 50 submissions.

url.description: URL you collect the diagnostic data for. Depending on the group settings, either this value or `ipaHostname` occurs.

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The rate limit ceiling for this endpoint.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

post.description: Verifies if an IP belongs to an edge server. For IPs verified positively, you can continue gathering diagnostic data with [Request content with cURL](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-curl), [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig), or [Test network connectivity with MTR](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-mtr) operations. You can enter up to 10 IPs.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

schema.description: Specifies IP addresses you want to [verify](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-verify-edge-ip) or get the [location data](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-locate-ip) for.

ipAddresses.description: Up to 10 IP addresses you want to get the data for.

post.description: Verifies if an IP belongs to an edge server and gets the geolocation data of its network. For IPs verified positively, you can continue gathering diagnostic data with [Request content with cURL](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-curl), [Get domain details with dig](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-dig), or [Test network connectivity with MTR](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-mtr) operations.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge Diagnostics API

schema.description: Specifies the IP address you want to [verify](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-verify-edge-ip) or get the [location data](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-locate-ip) for, or [both](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/reference/post-verify-locate-ip).

ipAddress.description: IP address you want to get the data for.

200.description: The response provides the verification results, network location data, and details about the request.

schema.description: Specifies the IP's network location, verification results, and details about the request.

createdTime.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the request was submitted.

executionStatus.description: Status of the request's execution, either `SUCCESS` or `FAILURE`.

request.description: IP address you want to get the data for.

ipAddress.description: IP address you want to get the data for.

result.description: Specifies the IP's network location and verification results.

geoLocation.description: Specifies the IP's network location. To learn more about the results, check [Verify and Locate IP results](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-diagnostics/docs/verify-locate-ip#results).

areaCode.description: List of comma-delimited area codes the IP's network maps to.

asNumber.description: Autonomous System Number the IP's network maps to.

city.description: Closest city within a 50-mile radius the IP's network maps to.

continent.description: ISO 3166 continent code the IP's network maps to.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 country code the IP's network maps to.

county.description: Counties the IP's network maps to. Multiple values are separated with `+`.

dma.description: Designated Market Area code the IP's network maps to.

fips.description: Federal Information Processing Standards code the IP's network maps to.

latitude.description: The latitude the IP's network maps to.

longitude.description: The longitude the IP's network maps to.

msa.description: Metropolitan Statistical Area code the IP's network maps to.

network.description: Network the IP maps to. The value may be `null` when edge servers lack that data.

networkType.description: Network type the IP maps to. The value may be `null` when edge servers lack that data.

pmsa.description: Primary Metropolitan Statistical Area code the IP's network maps to.

proxy.description: Proxy the IP maps to. The value may be `null` when the IP address is not a proxy.

regionCode.description: ISO 3166 region code the IP's network maps to.

throughput.description: Connection speed of the IP's network. Possible values are `low`, `medium`, `high`, or `vhigh`. IPv6 traffic is always `low`.

timeZone.description: Time zone used by the IP's network.

zipCode.description: Zip code the IP's network maps to. Multiple values are separated with `+` and ranges are separated with `-`.
